div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1792 Susa, Susiana, 1931-1932 Burial: before 311 B.C. (Le Rider) Contents: 111+ AR. From excavations Alexander III: 2 ob.; 2 hemiob. (unc. mints) Byzantium: 1 trihemiob. Cyzicus: 6+ hemiob. Miletus: 1 hemidr.; 13+ diob.; 1 trihemiob. Samos: 1 tetrob. Aspendus: 1 ob. Nagidus: 1 ob. Aradus: 1 ob. Sidon: 33 1/16-shekels; 2 or 3 1/32-shekels Babylon: 2 "lion" hemidr. Persia: 2 sigloi Unc. and illeg.: 7+ fr. Disposition: Paris 49, Teheran 62 Unvalla, MMAP 1934, p. 77 Schlumberger, L'argent glee, p. 7, no. 7 Le Rider, Suse, pp. 241-3, illus.
